title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices rose to 2,956.95 USD/T on December 24, 2025, marking a 0.32% increase from the previous day, 5.16% over the past month, and 15.51% year-over-year. UK aluminum futures reached $2,950 per tonne, near a three-year high, amid concerns over low supply and China's efforts to prevent overcapacity. Data was last updated on December 27, 2025.

title: Aluminum price falls to one-month low in wider commodity slump
summary: Aluminum prices dropped as much as 1.6% to $2,526 a ton on the London Metal Exchange, the lowest since November 14, amid a broader commodity slump and anticipation of the Federal Reserve's interest-rate decision. The decline followed data showing record Chinese output in November and strong US retail sales. Commerzbank forecasts a rise to $2,800 a ton in the second half of 2025 due to slowing Chinese production.

title: Aluminum price holds gain as withdrawals from warehouses in Asia surge
summary: Aluminum prices rose 0.2% to $2,622.50 a ton on the LME, holding gains amid surging withdrawals of nearly 100,000 tons from warehouses in Malaysia over two days. This reduced available stockpiles from a 14-month high, amid ongoing supply concerns and low historical inventory levels. The market has seen volatility due to trader control of stocks and new LME rules on positions and inventories.

title: LME Aluminium Prices Hit a Three-Year High in 2025 – Overseas Views on 2026 Outlook
summary: LME aluminum prices in 2025 showed volatility, reaching USD 2,800-2,900/tonne in November, the highest since 2022, driven by supply concerns and geopolitical factors. For 2026, analysts predict high volatility with short-term pushes toward USD 3,000/tonne due to supply bottlenecks, followed by rebalancing from new capacity in Indonesia, settling at USD 2,700–2,800/tonne.

title: Why Metal Prices Keep Climbing
summary: Precious and industrial metals, including aluminum, are surging to record highs as 2025 ends, driven by economic and geopolitical uncertainty. The article highlights ongoing climbs in metal prices amid broader market dynamics.

title: Environmental protection-driven production restrictions intensified, coupled with high aluminum prices suppressing demand, the operating rate of downstream aluminum processors weakened to 60.8% [SMM Aluminum Processing Weekly Survey]
summary: The weekly operating rate of leading domestic aluminum downstream processing enterprises fell 0.6 percentage points week-on-week to 60.8% due to weak orders, environmental protection controls, and high aluminum prices. Environmental restrictions escalated in central China, with a red alert for air pollution in Gongyi lasting until December 28, constraining production and transportation. Looking ahead, ongoing restrictions and weak year-end stockpiling are expected to keep operating rates under pressure.

title: Environmental protection-driven production restrictions intensified, coupled with high aluminium prices suppressing demand, the operating rate of downstream aluminium processors weakened
summary: The weekly operating rate of leading domestic aluminium downstream processing enterprises fell 0.6 percentage points week-on-week to 60.8%. This decline is attributed to intensified environmental protection-driven production restrictions and high aluminium prices suppressing demand. The report highlights challenges in the aluminium processing sector amid off-season dynamics.

title: Sortera Raises $45 Million to Scale AI Driven Aluminum Upcycling
summary: Sortera has secured $45 million to expand its AI-enabled aluminum sorting platform and construct a second U.S. facility in Tennessee. The technology transforms mixed aluminum scrap into targeted alloys, reducing energy demand by up to 95% compared to primary aluminum production and supporting decarbonization efforts. This aligns with U.S. priorities for reshoring manufacturing and reducing foreign supply chain dependency.

title: IAI Reports Progress In Greenhouse Gas Reduction Initiative
summary: The International Aluminium Institute reports progress in its Greenhouse Gas Initiative, with 80% of members setting long-term net-zero targets and most aiming for 50% reduction in Scope 1 and 2 emissions by 2030. The industry is investing in innovations like inert anode technology, carbon capture, renewable energy, and recycling to achieve decarbonization. Annual updates will track emissions reporting to enhance transparency and accountability.

title: Market trends, policy signals and innovation together suggest a recalibration within the global aluminium downstream industry
summary: Leadership changes, policy shifts like CBAM, market trends, and innovations are driving structural changes in the aluminum value chain ahead of 2026. Nagoya University researchers developed new aluminum alloys that maintain strength at high temperatures, are highly recyclable, and suitable for 3D printing, addressing limitations in engines, turbines, and aerospace. The aluminum foil sector is projected to grow at a 5% CAGR through 2030 due to investments.

title: Aluminum-air long-duration generation technology selected by Net Zero Innovation Hub for Data Centers for Groundbreaking Clean Backup Energy Initiative in Data Centers
summary: Phinergy’s aluminum-air long-duration generation technology has been selected by the Net Zero Innovation Hub for Data Centers from over 70 proposals as a clean backup energy solution. The hub, including Google, Microsoft, and others, will collaborate with Phinergy to scale the technology to MW levels and deploy it in live data center environments. This advances net-zero operations by replacing diesel generators with sustainable alternatives.

title: EGA Launches Expanded Aluminium Recycling Operations in the U.S. as Global Growth Accelerates
summary: Emirates Global Aluminium (EGA) has begun production at its expanded EGA Spectro Alloys plant in Minnesota, increasing recycling capacity to meet demand for low-carbon aluminum. The expansion supports sustainability by boosting recycled aluminum production. It aligns with global growth in sustainable aluminum supply chains.

title: CISA mills' daily crude steel output down 1.3% in mid-December, stocks up
summary: The China Iron and Steel Association reported average daily crude steel output of large and medium Chinese steel enterprises fell to 1.845 million tonnes during December 11–20, down 1.3% from early December, while finished steel inventories rose to 16.01 million tonnes as of December 20. The story also notes recent week-by-week movements in US raw steel production and broader inventory trends for Chinese mills.[1]

title: China pledges to control steel output during 2026–2030 period
summary: China said it will continue to regulate crude steel output and prohibit the addition of illegal new capacity from 2026–2030 as part of supply-side reforms and carbon-emission controls, noting crude steel output fell about 4% in the first 11 months of 2025 versus a year earlier. The announcement also referenced a planned export licensing system for roughly 300 steel-related items starting in 2026.[2]

title: China launches first million-tonne near-zero-carbon steel line
summary: China completed its first million-tonne near-zero-carbon steel production line in Zhanjiang using a hydrogen-based metallurgical electric smelting process and green electric furnaces, which the project owner says can cut carbon emissions by 50–80% and abate over 3.14 million tonnes of CO2 annually. The report highlights this as a major step in the industry's green transformation and offers performance details for the direct reduced iron and emissions reductions.[3]

title: Baosteel subsidiary starts China's first large-scale zero-carbon steel facility
summary: Baosteel Zhanjiang Iron and Steel commissioned what it describes as China's first million-tonne near-zero-carbon steel production line; the report outlines the company's claim of large-scale zero-carbon capability and positions the project within recent industry green initiatives. Full article content is behind a Mysteel subscription paywall.[4]

title: World crude steel production and outlook updates (worldsteel press releases)
summary: worldsteel's December 2025 release series reports monthly crude steel production figures for reporting countries (e.g., November 2025 down 4.6% vs. Nov 2024) and publishes a Short Range Outlook projecting global steel demand for 2025 to be roughly flat year-on-year at about 1,749 million tonnes. These releases provide recent production statistics and demand outlooks used widely across the industry.[5]

title: China pledges to control steel output during 2026–2030 period
summary: A re-reporting of the Chinese state planner's pledge to regulate crude steel output through 2026–2030, noting the 4% drop in crude steel production in the first 11 months of 2025 and the planned licensing system for steel-related exports; the piece summarizes official comments on supply-side reform and overcapacity.[6]

title: ArcelorMittal restarts steel production at Fos-sur-Mer site after fire
summary: ArcelorMittal restarted steel production at its Fos-sur-Mer plant in southern France following an earlier fire that disrupted operations; the notice covers restart details and operational continuity for the site. The item appears in an industry news feed summarizing recent production status changes.[8]

title: AI Startup Deep.Meta Pushes UK Steel Toward Lower Emissions
summary: Deep.Meta's AI-driven simulations achieved nearly 10% emissions reduction at Spartan UK’s Newcastle steel plant using physics-based digital twins. The technology is advancing through the UK government’s Manchester Prize, with potential to cut energy use and support net-zero goals in global steel markets. Industry leaders emphasize AI's role in making UK steel competitive and sustainable.

title: Accelerating towards clean steel's positive tipping point
summary: Clean steel technologies are approaching a positive tipping point driven by declining costs, growing demand from industries like automotive and construction, and supportive policies discussed at COP30. Global steel demand has doubled in 20 years, accounting for 7-8% of carbon emissions, making decarbonization critical. International cooperation and standards for low-emission steel are accelerating the shift to near-zero emissions production.

title: The Technical Reality of sCO₂ Commercial Waste-Heat Power
summary: Chaotan-1 demonstrates supercritical CO₂ (sCO₂) technology converting steel industry waste heat into grid-ready electricity, improving efficiency by up to 85% and reducing carbon intensity. It serves as a bridge technology complementing hydrogen-based green steel and electrification efforts. The project highlights systemic efficiency gains essential for net-zero pathways in steelmaking, which accounts for 7-8% of global emissions.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Copper prices rose to 5.77 USD/Lbs on December 26, 2025, marking a 2.96% increase from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have surged 13.73%, and are up 41.67% compared to the same time last year. The price hit a five-month peak amid strong demand and supply constraints.

title: Copper's Record-Breaking Rally: A Strategic Buy Opportunity Amid Tariffs, Supply Constraints, and the Energy Transition
summary: Copper prices reached an all-time high of $11,700 per metric ton in December 2025, fueled by supply shocks from mine outages, tariff uncertainties, and surging demand from the energy transition. Mine disruptions at key sites like Grasberg and Quebrada Blanca have created a 330kmt deficit projected for 2026. J.P. Morgan forecasts prices peaking at $12,500/mt in Q2 2026.

title: Copper Hits Five-Month Peak
summary: Copper futures climbed to $5.7 per pound, a five-month high, driven by global energy transition demand and supply constraints. The metal has gained 42% annually in New York. Prices partially pared gains but remain supported by robust fundamentals.

title: Copper Holds Near 5-Month High
summary: Copper futures hovered around $5.7 per pound near a five-month high, bolstered by tight supply and strong US economic growth. The US economy expanded at its fastest pace in two years in Q3, aiding prices. Robust industrial activity continues to underpin the market.

title: Copper price 26 dec 2025
summary: Copper prices surpassed $12,000 per tonne for the first time on record, propelled by mine disruptions and tariff concerns despite weak Chinese demand. Shanghai copper also set a record. The rally reflects persistent supply tightness.

title: Copper hits all-time high today: Will Trump's tariffs and mine disruptions keep prices soaring despite slowing China demand?
summary: Copper prices hit a record high above $12,000 per ton, driven by Trump tariff concerns and mine disruptions. The rally persists even amid weaker demand from China. Supply constraints are expected to maintain upward pressure.

title: Indonesia may slash nickel output to steady prices
summary: Indonesia, the world’s top nickel producer, is proposing a 34% reduction in nickel production for 2026 to 250 million tonnes from this year’s levels to combat oversupply and stabilize prices. The plan, outlined in the 2026 Work Plan and Budget, was reported by the Shanghai Metals Market citing the Indonesian Nickel Miners Association. This move addresses declining ore grades and aims to push nickel prices toward $18,000-$20,000 per tonne.

title: Talon buys nation's only nickel mine to create Midwest 'powerhouse'
summary: Talon Metals announced the purchase of the Eagle nickel mine in Michigan’s Upper Peninsula from Lundin Mining, along with a nearby mill, to expand nickel and copper production in the Midwest. The deal positions Talon to meet rising demand for metals used in stainless steel and EV batteries. Lundin will hold nearly 20% stake in Talon as part of the agreement.

title: Nornickel believes 2026 will bring dividends, CEO says
summary: Nornickel’s CEO Vladimir Potanin stated that the company expects positive cash flow in 2026, enabling resumption of dividend payments after skipping them in 2022-2024. The world’s largest nickel producer faces challenges from Western sanctions but is redirecting sales to Asia. Potanin anticipates dividends, though smaller than before, amid improving financial conditions.

title: Will Nickel Replace Lithium? The High-Stakes Race for Next-Gen Battery Dominance
summary: Nickel-based batteries, such as nickel-metal hydride (NiMH), offer superior performance, safety, and abundance compared to lithium, potentially reducing environmental harm and supply chain risks. Innovations in nickel-rich cathodes decrease reliance on cobalt, supporting sustainability in renewable energy storage. Challenges include the environmental impact of nickel mining, addressed through eco-friendly practices and recycling.

title: Recycling technology achieves 99% purity of nickel and cobalt from spent batteries
summary: A UNIST research team developed an electrochemical recycling process using a multifunctional deep eutectic solvent, recovering over 95% of nickel and cobalt from waste batteries with 99.9% purity. This method avoids complex chemicals and wastewater, enabling solvent reuse for at least four cycles and minimizing environmental impact. The innovation, published in Energy Storage Materials, advances sustainable battery recycling.

title: New IIT (ISM) Dhanbad Centre to Drive Critical Minerals Innovation for Clean-Tech
summary: IIT (ISM) Dhanbad launched a Critical Minerals Centre under India's National Critical Mineral Mission to boost innovation in minerals like nickel for clean energy technologies. The centre focuses on applied research and industry collaboration to secure supply chains for EVs, renewables, and battery storage. This addresses India's growing demand and reduces import dependence amid global competition.

title: New breakthrough could make 'green' hydrogen cheaper, faster to produce
summary: Researchers introduced smarter nickel coatings for alkaline electrolyzers using complexing agents and mathematical modeling to ensure uniform deposition. This innovation reduces nickel waste, improves efficiency, and lowers costs for green hydrogen production. The approach enhances manufacturing consistency and could apply to other electrochemical processes, promoting sustainability.
